Reviews.Title: “Hotel Alius; One star is enough!”
Reviews.Author: Arno v Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The rooms were Noisy. The rooms are old-fashioned. Breakfast was poor. The location however is good; in the centre of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good located hotel with moderate service”
Reviews.Author: yariq
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for two nights. I chose it because of it location - nearest metro station is just about 200 m and most of sights can be reached in 10-30 minutes by foot. But I’m afraid that location is the best in this hotel. We stayed in first room, it was rather spacious but bathroom definitely should be renovated. And Wi-Fi didn’t work in our room. You should be prepared to pay your stay one day before check-out - they have that strange rule. Staff was different - the man who met us in hotel was very friendly but I can’t say it about other personnel. And the breakfasts where different too - first day it was rather good with cheese and ham, but the next day there were only croissant and some pastries. The other annoying thing was that they didn’t give us keys from front door and every time when it was closed I had to use intercom. Then I lived in other hotel in the same building several years ago they gave me keys from all doors, and it was really convenient. So I can recommend this hotel only for short stays (2 or 3 nights), because of its location. But for longer stay I’d look for another place.

Reviews.Title: “Very budget hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Sharona6
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with a group of 12 people so I ended up staying here as I didn't want to be stranded by myself in another hotel. If I had the option I would've picked another hotel but you get what you pay for with a 1 star hotel. The room wasn't very clean and glad we were only there for two nights because the breakfast wasn't that great either. The hotel looked like it was going to collapse and the lift was pretty rubbish too. In total, we had reserved 4 rooms and all of the rooms were the same, not very clean and this hotel definitely needs a refurbishment. We spent most our time out of the hotel anyway. If you're looking for a budget place just to stay for a couple of nights cause you'll be out most of the time then it's ok but I wouldn't recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Horrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ty F
Reviews.Content: Location and service of the staff was great but the hotel facility was horrible. Hotel is in the 3rd floor of a multi-hotel complex. In the ground floor there's reception area but the lady there is horrible. It was raining so I was waiting for my husband to bring the umbrellas from the room and the lady at the reception insisted I couldnt wait by the door, I had to go up to the 3rd floor by my hotel or stay outside by the street under the rain. She was flat out rude. The hotel room was very small and noisy. The decorations were from the early 80's and to get Internet you had to go to the breakfast area. Breakfast was very limited and you had to cross the breakfast area to get to the rooms. I will NOT be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Ottershaw
Reviews.Content: With a family of five, staying in cities is a challenge, this hotel was perfect for us. Lift was always available, air con was not required and breakfast was topped up enough to satisy my three teenagers. It is basic, so if you want anything more than a room and simple facilities, this is not for you. Staff could not be more helpful. Close to main station, Metro and bus routes.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Room on Via Nazionale”
Reviews.Author: Brian S
Reviews.Content: This small hotel takes one portion of one floor in a multi-story building on Via Nazionale not far from Roma Termini. The small elevator to the floor is key controlled, so make sure your party has someone in good physical shape because there are many, many stairs to take to get to the hotel floor. The room was large and overlooked the street below. Don't worry about street noise as the windows are very well-insulated. But, as the room had no air-conditioning (just a portable fan), you'll need that window open in summer months. The service was adequate. The continental breakfast was very good, but in a small, windowless room.

Reviews.Title: “NO AIR CONDITIONING”
Reviews.Author: LJGisrael
Reviews.Content: I was supposed to stay here for three nights with my family. Arrived late at night to discover that there was no air conditioning that worked. I asked for a different room and was told that most had no air conditioning that worked and the ones that did were taken. Supposedly if they tried to turn on the air conditioning all of the electricity shorted out. I search the web for a simple hotel with air conditioning that works, I thought I had found one. What a disappointment. Had to open window onto main street but it still took hours to fall asleep in the heat and then traffic woke me up early in the morning. After a very basic breakfast I crossed the hall and took a room at the Everest Inn. a little more expensive but much nicer, better rooms, beds and bathroom. Much nicer decor and atmosphere and the AIR CONDITIONERS WORK. Take my advice and goo there, you will be much happier.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back but.....”
Reviews.Author: initz5
Reviews.Content: This is my second time to stay in this hotel. The first was in Aug. of 2010 wherein the experience was a pleasant one. This time I was surprised because we were not informed that they change towels every 2nd day. What surprsied me was the attitude of one of their hotel staff, who is an Oriental. They had one Oriental staff the previous year but not snooty and with an attitude like this one. I informed her about the towel because the prior year of our stay we were given fresh towels everyday. In a very condescending manner she informed that this is a bed and breakfast place and that was the rule. I will not mind being advised but goodness gracious tell me in a more polite and civilized manner. After all this is her bread and butter and that kind of attitude does not belong in the hospitality and hotel industry. I hope that management can do something to resolve this. It is giving the hotel a bad reputation plus it is not fair to the other hotel staff who are doing their best to make customer's stay a pleasant one. I would suggest giving the concerned staff more training in customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: Kyleaffd
Reviews.Content: I choose this hotel because it was close the Hotel Patria I stayed at before, but was booked so I tried to stay here. When I arrived at the hotel it’s not one hotel its 3 hotels in one building (each floor a different or two different hotels). After traveling to Rome, finding our way to the hotel only to find out that they didn’t have a room for us at that hotel but they had a room for us at their sister hotel at a different location. After making our way to the other hotel we check in and think we are going to your room. Once again they tell us we are checked in but not staying in this building. They walk us a half block away and put us in another building. There was not 3 beds in the room, it took 90 min to get the other bed, the door didn’t lock sometime and you could hear every one else in the building. Stayed one night and was able to get a room at Hotel Patria for the rest of my trip

Reviews.Title: “Strategic location, expensive compared to quality”
Reviews.Author: nowherian
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 6 nights. I was in Rome the week prior to Easter. It was a busy period and all hotels were extremely expensive. This hotel is 10-15 minutes walk from the Termini station. And its 8 minutes walk from Piazza Venizzia (sorry for all the miss-spellings). So if you want to walk everywhere and not take a taxi, this is a good location. We didn't take any taxis. From here you can walk to most tourist spots and/or take bus/metro. However, the the rooms are extremely small. Its like a small bedroom in your apartment and instead of a closet, there is a tiny bathroom and shower. Then when you exit your room you go into a hall way with some chairs which the public area. They did have free wireless internet which is good. they do provide a basic breakfast. A cheap bread, cheese and salami. Yogurt, milk, cereal and coffee from a vending machine. The hotel is on the third floor of the building. So the first day you get there, make sure you first go up and get the key to the elevator and come down and take your luggage up. I didn't know this so i had to haul my luggage up stairs which was a pain in the neck. The hotel staff were friendly and nice. In total, I would not stay at this place again as the price vs. quality was ridiculous.

Reviews.Title: “There is no good thing about this hotel except its location!”
Reviews.Author: fdmembership
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Alius Hotel for 3 nights and here are the negatives - Room/bathroom smell like sewage - They give 2 single beds located next to each other when you ask for double bed. It is possible that you fall to the ground since beds move when you sleep. - It is not possible to find anything to eat for breakfast. - No hot water! - Constant noise next to the room made sleeping impossible. - Towels/linens are not changed regularly. Positive: - Central location. We could have slept better in Termini!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, and great price!”
Reviews.Author: lum0s
Reviews.Content: Me and three friends stayed quadruple room for 3 nights and had a very pleasant experience. The location is perfect. It's walkable to the Spanish Steps and Victor Emmanuel Monument, and close by two subway/train stations (Republica and Termini). The English spoken reception staff mans the desk 24/7 and provides a light breakfast (cheese, salami, jam, croissant, coffee) every morning. Since we stayed in a quadruple, the price was a steal! I believe I paid around 40 euros a night, which is many folds better than the Paris hostel I stayed at for a similar price. Anyway, I highly recommend this place if you're looking for a clean, quiet, and convenient stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Smells like sewage”
Reviews.Author: strannikny
Reviews.Content: Location is close to the railway station and walking distance from all the major sites. Rooms are not bad, but bathroom is small and has a terrible smell of sewage that does not go away and gets even stronger if the door stays closed - a real "good" way to wake one up in the morning except it's a challenge to make yourself enter that little smelly room. Breakfast is very limited compared to other hotels we stayed at. They have simple serials, bread, coffee, juice, and yogurt. One really good thing is free internet that we did not have at any other hotel in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel. Very clean but basic.”
Reviews.Author: Gaz_Edge
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for three nights. She is very picky when it comes to bathrooms and cleanliness - she was delighted with this hotel! It's absolutely spotless. The rooms do look a little out of date, but it didnt affect our stay in the slightest. Breakfast was basic but substantial. Staff were very friendly and spoke English. The hotel is in a great location, loads of shops and restaurants near by, as well as a tube station. The only negative thing we could think of was that the rooms were noisy. Not from noise outside, but within the hotel. The Walls are quite thin and you can hear people talking in the rooms next door and at breakfast. However, I have stayed in much more expensive hotels that have had a similar problem - it was easily solved with some ear plugs. Overall a great budget hotel. Would definitely stay again

Reviews.Title: “Good little budget hotel, but the AC (lack of) was an issue”
Reviews.Author: suprgrover
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of nights during a hot July. Here were the positives and negatives of this hotel: Positives: - location. Very close to Termini, and a downhill walk to the Colosseum and historical centre. - service was great. Very friendly staff, and hard-working. Nothing seemed to be too much trouble. - breakfast was great for a budget hotel. Negatives: - our room did not have its own AC, but the general AC of the hotel. This might have been fine, if the AC was working. The fact that it was 42c in the day in Rome, and high 30s at night while we were there, made the room very hot and sleep tough. They did provide a fan for us and apologized sincerely. - the power would shut off every hour or so. The desk employee would have to rush to the panel and flip the breaker on again. We got used to it, and even had a laugh or two at it, and would make a guessing game out of when the power would shut off. - the crazy lady on the bottom floor. The hotel shares the building with a few other hotels and businesses, so there is a general use lobby on the main floor. There is an older lady (who I think is some building manager of some sort), who yells at you if you linger for a minute or two. This happened a couple of times when I was waiting for a friend or two to meet me from their rooms. She is harmless, but unsettling at first. In the end, I would recommend this hotel as you get what you pay for, has a good location, and really friendly service. I assume the lack of AC when we were there was temporary, and I would rate it higher if the Ac was.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Cheerful- Great Value”
Reviews.Author: rs899
Reviews.Content: It is a budget hotel, but does the basics well. Location about 200 meters south of Repubblica metro stop on Via Nazionale puts it pretty close to the historic areas, but at a Termini price. There is a convenient fairly large DeSpar grocery store three blocks away further down Via Nazionale (away from Termini). Room was cozy for 3 people but quiet (ask for a room on the left hand corridor as you face the breakfast room from the reception desk). Breakfast was pretty good, not a lot of variety, but the basics they had were of good quality. Has a lift, but really tiny- you will want to walk down the three floors to leave. For what we paid, I would stay there again in a heatbeat

Reviews.Title: “Solid all the way around”
Reviews.Author: Jaschullo
Reviews.Content: Location was very good...Not the best, but convenient to all locations in Rome. It is a very easy walk from the Termini. Everyone in the hotel was very friendly and spoke English and more then willing to help. Room was cozy and cleaned every day which was nice. Bathroom was fine. The room was very quiet which was great as this is tough to fine. Reasonably priced and I would definitely recommend

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Lovely Rooms”
Reviews.Author: irelandreg
Reviews.Content: We moved here after walking out of a previous hotel. What a find. The room was spacious and very clean and cool with a tiled flood. Beds very comfortable, cleaned each day. No issues with location as it's bang in the centre, easy to walk to places to eat and drink and near enough to train station. Staff always willing to help without being intrusive. Despite being in the centre there was no noise at night and we slept well

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel with teriffic service”
Reviews.Author: peterd1331
Reviews.Content: We were given a choice of two simple but nice quad rooms for only 120 euros - a steal in Rome! The location is great - 4 blocks from Termini Train Station and 2 from Repubblica Metro Stop - very useful. The staff, especially Jacob and Leonardo, was very helpful in recommending restaurants and giving directions. The wifi and air conditioning worked well, but the breakfast was decidedly subpar. Only packaged croisants, crackers, and cookies and a coffee and tea machine. And the machine is only free for a 2 hour window in the morning and then you have to pay for it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel For Your Trip”
Reviews.Author: Dokes3
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for a stay in Rome. It is ideally located to all tourist attractions. A short walk from the mail bus and train station. I read numerous bad reviews about this hotel but can say that they are all wrong. You are not going to get a really luxurious hotel in Rome unless you want to pay big money. It is located on the 3rd floor of a building. There is a lift and access and egress is easy 24/7. The staff were very helpful and spoke perfect english. The rooms were very clean and tidy. Comfortable with an en suite. Perfect for a romantic break.

Reviews.Title: “Silent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dominatorev
Reviews.Content: I was here in May 2008 for a 5 nights with my girlfriend. I was in nro. 4 room. Room: No balcony, quite small room, TV was 20" inches = small one. One closet only, writing table and 2 night-tables. Air conditioning was very good and working. In the closet there was safety box, where you can put your own combination to use it. In the bathroom there was shower and hairdryer and of course a toilet. Bathroom was average size. No noisy from the streets but no sightseeing you didn´t see from room number 4. Rooms was cleaned every day. The whole hotel was Rome styling if you look it in the street. Large big door , which lead you to the elevator lobby, elevator was lock, so you need a key from the hotel inside. Steps were about 100, if you do not use the elevator. Hotel was situated in the 3rd floor, 10 rooms. It is about years 1800-1900 building. Hotel lobby: There was small desk and some tourist infos, like a good map to get it for you, so you do not need to buy a map. The same lobby was the breakfast. Two sitting bar-styling tables, which you eat. Breakfast wasn´t good. There were not vegetables or fruits. There was croissants, Kellogs Frosties, milk, youghurt and juices. The food was quite good enough, no complaining of that. We didn't had a remote control for an airconditioning, so the hotel keeper (only one keeper at the time) borrow some room and help us to put it on. Staff: 2 men and 1 woman, quite young. Not good english for the Indian man or woman. The Italian guy had enough good english to dealt with. Staff was very friendly. They managed to keep hotel in good shape. If you want good and cheap hotel about 1-1,5km to central shopping street, Via del Corso, please pick Alius Hotel. Metro is quite near in Repubblica, about 100 meters from hotel to repubbica metro station. 500 meters from Termini... Metroline is not lead you to direct central, where is Trevi, Via del Corso...It is only taking you surroundings of Rome, like Colosseum, Spanish Steps and Vatican. That's the reason why we walked so much. -Finn man-

Reviews.Title: “PRISON LIKE”
Reviews.Author: hatedmyhotel
Reviews.Content: It is my hope that this description will save a poor traveler from making a huge mistake by staying at Hotel Alius. I am a firm believer in starting off on a positive note: so, the best thing about the centrally-located Allius is that you will see all of Rome because you will never want to return to this prison-like establishment. The elevator is a nightmare, the rooms remind you of caves from the 1970's, the bathrooms are dysfunctional, and the hotel employees do not know a wink of basic English or Spanish. Over our 4 night stay, the sink clogged 4 times, our shower door fell off and was never replaced, and our power went out. When I asked for extra toilet paper for our hotel room, the receptionist brought me milk.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - shame about the rooms/staff/breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Cooksister
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel from 3-7 May 2007 - unexpectedly, as I had booked a room at the Hotel Pichierri through Lastminute.com, based largely on the reviews on this site. But upon arrival at the Pichierri, we were told by the man on the front desk reception that we had been "assigned" to another hotel. I pointed out to him that we had in fact booked into and had a pre-paid voucher for the Pichierri, but he insisted that there was nothing he could do and that we had to go to their sister hotel, the Hotel Alius. Not an auspicious start. So we schlepped our suitcase from the Via Flavia over to the Via Nazionale to the Alius. Be warned - the hotel reception is on the third floor and to use the elevator you need a key, which you obviously won't have when you arrive. You need to ring the buzzer downstairs on the pavement to ask somebody to come down and fetch you. The elevator looks antedeluvian and bits of it were held together with masking tape - a warm welcome it ain't. And once we got to reception things did not improve. I have to say that I have never had a less friendly reception in my life. The woman on reception angry and surly when we arrived and stayed that way throughout our stay. My husband tried to get an explanation as to why we had been sent away from the hotel we booked but all she did was haul out a map and say "this metro for the Colosseum, this metro for the Vatican" as if that solved all problems. And she insisted on taking a photocopy of BOTH our passports - can somebody please explain why this intrusion is necessary when I have prepaid all accommodation costs, particularly when identity fraud is such a problem?? We were taken to room 7 and my first impression was that it was probably the most depressing and charmless hotel room I have ever been in. Granted, the room is large but for the rest you have bare tiled floors, the bare minimum of spartan furnishings (not even two chairs!), a mirror placed in the least convenient space by the door, and not even a picture on the wall. OK, so there was an en-suite bathroom and everything seemed clean - but threadbare: the curtains were no longer attached to all their hooks, there were cracks in the walls and our blanket had at least two cigarette burns in it. All the bulbs were energy saving bulbs that gave the room a blueish and depressing cast (except for the two halogen lights by the bathroom mirror - which didn't work!) The Lastminute.com description talks of a minibar, a safe and complimentary mineral water in each room - hahahaha! Don't hold your breath. No, actually DO hold your breath - especially when opening the bathroom door once it's been closed for a while. Although the bathroom was probably the best part of the room (clean and equipped with limited free soap and shampoo, plus a shower with good pressure), once the door had been closed for an hour or so - like every day after they cleaned it - it smelt overwhelmingly and nauseatingly of ancient drains. And, inexplicably, garlic. When we got home in the afternoons, we would first have to open the window and the bathroom door to get air circulating before it was safe to enter. Although the double glazing kept the traffic noise out, the room door was paper thin and you could hear every time a guest rang the buzzer to get in (door was locked after about 8pm). There was not a single English channel on the TV - not even CNN! And don't get me started on the breakfast. The breakfast room was a windowless cubbyhole on the way from the front desk to the rooms and the food verged on the inedible. There was cheap artficial fruit cordial, yucky coffee from a dispensing machine, yoghurts (the best thing there), crackers with jam and butter, and my personal favourites, "7 day" croissants in little individual foil packets (because, of course you want a croissant that's been hanging around for seven days!) made with margarine and coated in a sugary glaze. It was beyond awful and we did not return after the first day, despite breakfast being included in our rate. The only time we asked the receptionist anything (where to catch a no. 44 bus) they panicked, searched the internet for 10 minutes and could not come up with an answer. There was also a constant kerfuffle with the elevator. You needed a key to operate the elevator and you had to manually shut both the inner and outer doors for the car to move. Neither of these were spring-loaded, so if the customer before you had forgotten to pull the inner doors firmly shut when they disembarked, the car would be stranded. On the morning that we left (at 05h45) there was nobody at Reception and somebody had left the elevator doors open on the ground floor - so we had to haul ther27kg suitcase down six flights of stairs. So - what's the good news?! The beds/matresses were brand new and very comfortable (if you like a firm mattress as I do!) The location could not be better at the price. You are two blocks away from Repubblica metro station and a ten minute easy walk from Termini train station. Via Nazionale is a big throughfare for busses, so catching a bus home was never a problem. The area also felt safe at night, even very late (although Termini is to be avoided after dark!). When I opened my window, I looked across the road at the beautiful church of St Paul's Within the Walls which also had a fantastic carillion on Sunday. There is a Spar supermarket about three blocks along Via Nazionale (walking away from Repubblica) which is open until 9pm, even on Sunday. Avoid the Byron Bar on the corner of the block - they were more expensive than the place where we had a drink on the famously touristy Piazza Navona!! (And for bargain drinking, check out the early evening happy hours at the bars on the Campo dei Fiori.) Although I was very uhappy when we were first shown the room (and although I still object to being "reassigned" to a hotel I did not choose), by the end of the stay I had made peace with the shortcomings of the place. It's a 2-star hotel, so you need to go in with your eyes open, but let's face it - how much time are you planning to spend in your room - you're in Rome! If you want a romantic or luxury weekend, or if you are the type of traveller who likes to have a helpful concierge to help with bookings and directions and calling cabs, this is not for you. As a base for budget travel, it's OK. Just don't eat the breakfast or try to ask the staff anything!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Awful”
Reviews.Author: jasminet
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I had a terrible time at this hotel. there was a group of us there in two separate rooms - my sister and her husband and my fiance and myself. Along with one other couple, we seemed to be the only guests in the hotel. I know why now! For starters, it is dingy and depressing. Our bedroom had 3 beds in it - one double and two singles. The beds, and a cupboard were the only furniture. And the floors were tiled. So it felt like we were staying in a youth hostel and had no atmosphere, but that was the least of our problems. The toilet ran, constantly, even after we complained. The breakfast was absolutely disgusting. Coffee from an instant machine (so even worse than instant), and pre-packaged old dry toast. There was also jam and yoghurt and fruit cordial (completely undrinkable). It was just awful. The worst part of our stay was the very end. We organised a late checkout with the manager (who seemed very nice), as our flight didn't leave until 9 pm. Then just as we were leaving that morning to do the remainder of our site-seeing, the woman working behind the counter threw a tantrum and insisted the manager should not have let us have a late check-out, and that she didn't believe this had happened, and that there were more guests staying the following day (even though the manager had told us there weren't and we seemed to be the only guests in the hotel while we were there). She insisted we pack up our belongings and check out then and there. It was not a good stay. I don't know how it compares to other places in Rome in a similar price bracket but if that's all you get, I'd much rather save up and stay somewhere decent because staying in this place really put a dampner on our holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JulieAp
Reviews.Content: Hotel Alius was a great deal for central Rome - a few blocks from the train station, and steps from Piazza della Repubblica. Unlike other hotels near the train station, this area was nice, clean and safe. Don't look too hard for the name of the hotel! The address brought us to a big wooden door with no name above it. We were a little confused at first, but we quickly found a buzzer for Hotel Alius. The man at reception came right down and directed us to the third floor. Apparently, different hotels operate on different floors of this building Our room was small, clean, and very simply furnished with new furniture. It was nothing fancy, but we were comfortable here. The staff was very helpful and curteous. Our room was located right off of the breakfast area, so it was noisy in the morning. The continental breakfast was only fair. If you're looking for a clean room, in a great area, for a good price, this is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: Marius-Hanganu
Reviews.Content: They first checked us in a room with no natural light. Quite scary - felt like prison cell. Asked for another room, they gave us another room - quite good at first sight. But then the problems started: the A/C was at max speed maintaining 16 Celsius degrees constantly. We told them about the problem, they told us will fix it the next day - so we slept in 16 degrees temp (no way to turn it off, could not even unplug it). The next day - the unpleasant surprise to see that nothing was fixed (beside A/C, TV had only one station and two light bulbs were not functional). The indian guy suddenly didn't talk English no more. Talked to the manager who told us it's our travel agency's fault and hung the phone (?!?! - like they could knew they can't have proper A/C). The same promise - will fix it the next day. The third and the last day it was too much - we faced the same ignorance and so we slept 3 nights in a room with practically unstoppable A/C, broken TV and half of the lights in the room working. And of course the breakfast which could hardly be called breakfast. Of course, if you just dump the croissant, yogurt, butter and jam in your stomach, you could feel full up. But if you're looking for decency and well-treat, that's not the place.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't like this hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Only stayed in this hotel for one night. It just wasn't a comfortable hotel. The staff were friendly enough, but the hotel was shabby. The breakfast was set up the night before in the hall outside the room, which was a bit weird. It also took us ages to find because of its out of the way location.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Alius
HotelInfo.Address: Via Nazionale 243, 00187 Rome, Italy
